meanings.definition: Prevent or hinder (an action or event) from happening
meanings.sent1: The loud noise preempts my ability to concentrate on my homework.
meanings.sent2: The security alarm preempts any unauthorized entry into the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel preempts the bird feeder by stealing all the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain preempts our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look preempts any misbehavior in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Take action in order to prevent (an anticipated event) from happening; forestall
meanings.sent1: She quickly preempts any arguments by offering a compromise.
meanings.sent2: The doctor preempts potential health issues by recommending regular exercise.
meanings.sent3: The clever magician preempts the audience's guesses with surprising tricks.
meanings.sent4: The wise leader preempts conflicts by promoting open communication.
meanings.sent5: The diligent student preempts failure by studying diligently.
